resources.string: Kanji (tip: to select and/or copy-paste just long-click the edit box. To search for a part of a word just select it and press search)
Reading (when searching, romaji is automatically translated to both hiragana and katakana)
Deletes all Aedict-downloaded files, including dictionaries
Warning: there is less than %d kb of free space on the sd card (%d kb). The download will most probably fail.
The %s dictionary is missing. Do you wish to download it now?
Dictionary data files are currently taking up to %d kb. Do you wish to clean the files?

http://code.google.com/p/aedict

References:

Lucene: http://lucene.apache.org/java/docs/
Kanji recognizer (C) by Todd David Rudick, http://www.cs.arizona.edu/projects/japan/JavaDict/
SKIP code system (C) by Jack Halpern
Stroke order diagrams (C) Jim Rose, http://www.kanjicafe.com
Japanese search (romaji is automatically translated both to hiragana and katakana)
Which romanization to use, both for romaji input and for display
Please select the visual style of the kanji. Look at the kanji in question and decide if it can visually be divided as (choose the first that applies):
into left and right sides, such as: 行 引 相 時 八 噛
into top and bottom parts, such as: 学 見 京 字 分 二 春
into an enclosing structure and an internal structure, such as: 気 週 間 広 国 月 通
none of the above, such as: 下 西 士 自 中 事 火 女
has a horizontal line at the top (e.g. 下, 西)
has a horizontal line at the bottom (e.g. 士, 自).
has a vertical line through (e.g. 中, 事)
none of the above (e.g. 火, 女)
Count the strokes in the leftmost part and then the number of strokes left in the right part. For example, in kanji 引, leftmost part has three strokes, and the right half has one.
Count the strokes in the topmost part and then the number of strokes left in the lower part. For example, in kanji 春, topmost part has five strokes, and the lower half has four.
Count the strokes in the enclosing part and then the number of strokes left in the internal part. For example, in kanji 通, enclosing part has three strokes, and the internal part has seven.
Number of strokes in the leftmost part:
Number of strokes in the right part:
Number of strokes in the topmost part:
Number of strokes in the lower part:
Number of strokes in the enclosing part:
Number of strokes in the internal part:
Please count all the strokes in the character, and then choose the first from the options listed below:
Translate japanese text. Copy-paste the text here (e.g. from a browser). Simple, stupid and slow :-)
Available dictionaries (click on the name to install)
To add items to the notepad just long-click on Result Browser or Analysis Window and select \"Add to notepad\"
Please note that you must use the proper stroke order and count, otherwise your kanji will not be recognized. Also it does not recognize hiragana nor katakana characters.
All introduction dialogs will be shown again

For full changelog please see http://baka.sk/aedict/changes-report.html

- Integrated with Android Search (Android 1.6 and higher only)
- Better sorting of results
- Fixed broken search from the detail screen, automatic Tanaka dictionary download, Radicals overflowing on Archos5
- The config dialog looks more Android-like

Mama wa mise de _banana_ o kau.
Mom buys/will buy bananas at the store.
_Jimu_ wa manga o yomu.
Jim will read a comic book.
Ojii-san wa sugu kaeru.
Grandpa will return soon.
Watashi wa ringo o taberu.
I'll eat an apple.
_Naomi_ wa terebi o miru.
Naomi will watch TV.

Mama wa mise de _banana_ o kaimasu.
Mom buys/will buy bananas at the store.
_jimu_ wa manga o yomimasu.
Jim will read a comic book.
Ojii-san wa sugu kaerimasu.
Grandpa will return soon.
Watashi wa ashita kimemasu.
I'll decide tomorrow.
Jerry wa sugu heya kara demasu.
Jerry will come out of the room soon.
Ayako wa mainichi terebi o mimasu.
Ayako watches the TV every day.

Watashi wa kasa o kaimasen.
I'm not going to buy an umbrella.
Kare wa machimasen.
He won't wait.
Kimiko wa oosaka ni ikimasen.
Kimiko isn't going to Osaka.
Watashi wa ima tabemasen.
I'm not going to eat now.
Kanojo wa kasa o karimasen.
She isn't going to borrow an umbrella.

_jon_ wa Sendai ni ikimashita.
John went to Sendai.
Kodomotachi wa kouen de asobimashita.
The children played at the park.
Yoshi wa ringo o tabemashita.
Yoshi ate an apple.
Shizu wa manga o kaimashita.
Shizu bought a comic book.
_Bobbu_ wa sono eiga o mimashita.
Bob saw that movie.

_jon_ wa Sendai ni ikimasen deshita.
John didn't go to Sendai.
Kodomotachi wa kouen de asobimasen deshita.
The children didn't play at the park.
Yoshi wa ringo o tabemasen deshita.
Yoshi didn't eat an apple.

Watashi wa kasa o kaitai.
I want to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa asobitai.
The children want to play.
_Bobbu_ wa tempura o tabetai desu.
Bob wants to eat tempura.
_Miki_ wa sono eiga o mitai desu.
Miki wants to see that movie.
Watakushi wa kasa o kaitakunai.
I don't want to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa asobitakunai.
The children don't want to play.
_Terebi_ o mitakereba, yuushoku o hayaku tabenasai.
If you want to watch TV, hurry and eat your dinner.
Shichiji no densha ni noritakereba, ashita hayaku okimashou.
If you want to make the 7:00 train, let's get up early tomorrow.

Ikimashou.
Let's go.
Tabemashou.
Let's eat.
Yasumimashou.
Let's take a break.
Watashi ga hakobimashou.
I'll carry this / these [for you].
Esa o agemashou.
(To a pet) Let's get you some food.
Anata no jitensha o naoshimashou.
I'll fix your bicycle. / I'll help you fix your bicycle.

Tabenasai!
Eat!
Minasai!
Look!
Yominasai!
Read it!
Iinasai!
Tell me!
Suwarinasai!
Sit down!
Koko ni kinasai!
Come here!

Watashi wa kasa o kai ni iku.
I'm going to go buy an umbrella.
Watashi wa kasa o kai ni ikimasu.
I'm going to go buy an umbrella.
Chuuka ryouri o tabe ni ikimashou.
Let's go out and eat Chinese food.
Watashi wa kouen ni asobi ni ikitai.
I want to go play in the park.

_Miki_ wa watashi no atarashii _pasokon_ o mi ni kuru.
Miki is coming over to see my new PC.
_Miki_ wa watashi no atarashii _pasokon_ o mi ni kimashita.
Miki came over to see my new PC.
_Robbu_ wa jitensha o kari ni kimasen deshita.
Rob didn't come to borrow the bicycle.
Asobi ni kite ne.
Come over for a visit, okay? (Asobi ni kuru is a set phrase used to invite someone "to come for a pleasure visit." You may hear it often, but don't take it literally. Most of the time it is just a polite nothing, made obvious by having no date or time attached to it.)
It is hard to do something.

Kono budou wa tabenikui.
These grapes are hard to eat.
Kono kanji wa yominikui.
These kanji are hard to read.
Sono tatemono wa minikui.
That building is hard to see. (Besides the converted verb minikui, which means "hard to see," there is also an adjective minikui meaning "ugly." Accordingly, the sentence sono tatemono wa minikui could also mean "that building is ugly." Be especially careful to make the intended meaning clear when using it to refer to people or their property.)
It is easy to do something.

Kono _pasokon_ wa tsukaiyasui.
This PC is easy to use.
Kanojo no namae wa oboeyasui.
Her name is easy to remember.
Kono kanji wa kakiyasui.
This kanji is easy to write.
I went too far doing something.

Kare wa itsumo nomisugiru.
He always drinks too much.
Kimiko wa tabesugimashita.
Kimiko ate too much.
Kodomotachi wa _terebi_ o misugiru.
The kids watch too much TV.
I did X while I was doing Y.

_Bobu_ wa hatarakinagara ongaku o kiku.
Bob listens to music while he works.
Kimiko wa benkyou shinagara terebi o mimasen.
Kimiko doesn't watch TV while studying.
Hanashinagara sanpo shimashou.
Let's take a walk while we talk.

_Jon_ wa kasa o kawanai.
John isn't going to buy an umbrella.
_Jimu_ wa manga o yomanai.
Jim doesn't read comic books.
Ojii-san wa sugu kaeranai desu.
Grandpa isn't going to return soon.
Watashi wa _terebi_ o minai desu.
I'm not going to watch TV.
Sachiko wa konai.
Sachiko won't be coming.
I probably do not do something.

_Jon_ wa kasa o kawanai deshou.
John probably isn't going to buy an umbrella.
_Jimu_ wa manga o yomanai deshou.
Jim probably doesn't read comic books.
Yuki wa furanai deshou.
It probably won't snow.

Watashi wa _terebi_ o minakatta.
I didn't watch TV.
Sachiko wa konakatta.
Sachiko didn't come.
Ojii-san wa shinbun o yomitakunakatta.
Grandpa didn't want to read the newspaper.
If I do not do something

Ojii-san ga sugu kaeranakereba watashi wa _makudonarudo_ ni ikimasu.
If Grandpa doesn't return soon I'm going to McDonald's.
_Miki_ ga heya o tsukawanakereba Junko wa tsukaitai desu.
If Miki isn't going to use the room Junko wants to use it.
Naoko wa kasa o karinakereba koukai suru deshou.
If Naoko doesn't borrow an umbrella she'll probably regret it.
I have to do something (It won\'t go otherwise)

_Jimu_ wa ima kaeranakereba narimasen.
Jim has to return now.
_Raura_ wa kasa o kawanakereba narimasen.
Laura has to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa tabenakereba narimasen.
The children must eat.
_Jimu_ wa ima kaeranakereba naranai deshou.
Jim probably has to return now.
_Raura_ wa kasa o kawanakereba naranai deshou.
Laura probably needs to buy an umbrella.
Kodomotachi wa tabenakereba naranai deshou.
The children probably need to eat.

Obaa-san wa kodomotachi ni soto de asobaseru.
Grandma lets the children play outside.
Okaa-chan wa Kimiko ni kasa o kawaseru.
Mom will have Kimiko buy an umbrella.
Sensei wa gakusei ni mainichi shimbun o yomaseru.
The teacher makes the students read the newspaper every day.
Roku ji ni kodomotachi ni yuushoku o tabesaseru.
I'll have the kids eat dinner at 6:00.
_Jon_ ni raishuu made ni kimesaseru.
I'll have John decide by next week.
Kare ni ashita kosaseru.
I'll have him come tomorrow.
Otou-san wa _Bobu_ ni benkyou saseru.
Dad will make Bob study.
Kanojo ni saseru.
I'll have her do it.
Ritsuko wa Kumi ni pen o kawasemashita.
Ritsuko had Kumi buy a pen.
Ojii-san wa kodomotachi ni ame o tabesasemasen.
Grandpa won't let the children eat candy.
Watashi wa Kenji ni eigo o benkyou sasetai desu.
I want to have Kenji study English.
_Jon_ ni mise ni ikasemashou.
Let's have John go to the store.
Kodomotachi ni _terebi_ o misemashou ka.
Shall we let the kids watch TV?
I did X without doing Y

Kare wa yuushoku o tabezu ni nemashita.
He went to bed without eating dinner.
Kyou Shizuka wa kyoukasho o motazu ni gakkou ni kimashita.
Today Shizuka came to school without her textbook.
_Bobu_ wa maemotte denwa sezu ni _Jon_ no ie ni ikimashita.
Bob went to John's house without calling first.

Raishuu watashi wa Okayama ni iku deshou.
I'll probably go to Okayama next week.
Kenji wa atarashii kuruma o kau deshou.
Kenji will probably buy a new car.
Ashita wa ame (ga furu) deshou.
It will probably rain tomorrow.
Oosaka ni iku deshou?
You're going to Osaka, aren't you? (Please note that ka is not added at the end - a rising intonation is used instead)
_Sue_ wa kuru deshou?
Sue's coming, isn't she?
Tomoka wa eigo no shukudai o suru deshou?
Tomoka will do her English homework, right?

Raishuu watashi wa Oosaka ni iku hazu desu.
I'm supposed to go to Osaka next week.
_Jon_ wa sugu kuru hazu.
John should be coming soon.
_Bobu_ mo ikitai hazu.
Bob will probably also want to go.

Kanojo ni denwa suru hou ga ii.
I/we should call her.
Watashitachi wa sukoshi yasumu hou ga ii.
We had better rest a little.
Anata wa motto nihongo o benkyou suru hou ga ii.
You should study Japanese more.
Kyou densha de iku hou ga ii.
It would be better to go by train today.
Raishuu suru hou ga ii.
It would be better to do it next week.
Ato de taberu hou ga ii.
It would be better to eat later.
Yakiniku no hou ga ii.
I'd rather have a barbeque.
Inu no hou ga ii.
I'd rather get a dog.
Hawaii no hou ga ii.
I'd rather go to Hawaii.
I don\'t know whether I do something or not.

Kare wa dekiru ka dou ka kikimashou.
I'll ask him whether or not he can do it.
Watashitachi wa iku ka dou ka mada wakarimasen.
I don't know if we are going yet.
Hideki wa ashita yasumu ka dou ka wakarimasu ka.
Do you know if Hideki has tomorrow off?

Watashi wa raishuu Oosaka ni iku kamo shiremasen.
Maybe I'll go to Osaka next week.
_Jakku_ mo kuru kamo shiremasen.
Jack may also come.
Ashita yuki ga furu kamo shiremasen.
It might snow tomorrow.
Ashita ame ga furu kamo shirenai.
It might rain tomorrow.
Konban watashitachi wa soto de taberu kamo shirenai.
We may eat out tonight.
